name: Charlesmark Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel, the rooms are small but well equipped and suited our week long stay perfectly;, the bathrooms have speakers in which is pretty cool for keeping up with whatever's on the TV whilst you, shower etc. if they were a few feet bigger this would surely be a 4-star hotel. The staff are helpful and welcoming, and the complimentary breakfast pretty decent; pastries, coffee, the usual.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.text: Very pleased with everything.
reviews.title: Great for a solo business traveler!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed for 3 days at the Charlesmark and was very pleased. I was attending a conference at a very formal nearby luxury hotel. Not only do I not feel very comfortable in luxury hotels (I like to dress casually), but the price at that hotel and most of the others nearby was very high. The Charlesmark's rooms ARE small and if I had been traveling with my family, this might not have worked. However, for a single traveler, it was great. The rooms were pleasantly decorated. Beds were very comfortable. Shower was tiled slate, has good water pressure/spray, and the room had wall mounted speakers with an additional speaker in the bathroom. The hair dryer was powerful. Another reviewer complained a lot about the TV channels and lack of DVD player for movies. I did not want to spend my free time in the Back Bay of Boston watching TV--there was plenty to do and lots of shopping and dining in easy walking distance. The location was ideal for me. The breakfast was not expansive, but as a light breakfast eater, it suited me fine. Good coffee. The martini bar downstairs was a bit too trendy for my tastes, but there were plenty of other places nearby that were great (I'm more of an Irish pub type of girl). Unlike the previous reviewer, I did not hear any noise from adjacent rooms--I was there on a weekend when it appeared to be quite full, too. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A 3 dressed up as a 9
Great location, great value.
reviews.text: We booked the Charlesmark on what was available on the web. It's a nice looking hotel, with nice wood touches and accents. I also understand that in Boston's back bay area, particularly, rooms tend to be small and pricey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These rooms are very cramped and the beds are small. Staying with another person in the smaller rooms with a double bed, had us tripping over each other constantly. They are very poorly laid out and nothing is really all that ergonomic. Very illogical. Everything looked nice, but the experience of staying there was far from pleasant.
reviews.title: very much ok :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Charlesmark hotel. We had read the reviews (and compared prices) of all of the hotels in the Copley Square area and picked this one accordingly. We were not disappointed! The Charlesmark is a boutique hotel perfect for couples and single people looking for a great location and a very clean comfortable room; the rooms and bathrooms are very small so I would not recommend more than 2 people in a room. The decor is modern and trendy--flat screen tv, great stereo system (played music even in the bathroom!), free bottled water in the room. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet even though we were put in the room right above the bar on the lobby level. The free continental breakfast consisted of fruit, coffee, juice, bagels, muffins and doughnuts from Dunkin' Doughnuts (I think there was also some instant oatmeal as well)--which was very nice and carefully attended to by the staff each morning.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in the heart of Copley Square

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for location, price, cleanliness and fun trendy atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great hotelin a great loaction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Charlesmark to be a great hotel. The rooms and the bar area are well decorated and feel very cool and funky. Our room was very small but a oversized mirror meant that we did not feel crowded. The bathroom was also very well designed with a slate shower cubicle and floor.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

likes.disliked: — Buy the combined whale watching/aquarium ticket. Great value and you will see whales!

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: The free breakfast consisted of bagels, muffins, juice and coffee. All really tasty.

reviews.title: Clean, Stylish and Well-Located Gem
reviews.text: There is free internet access which meant that we could check into our return flight on-line and keep in touch with family and friends whilst away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had our second visit at the Charlesmark, this one a three-night stay after we were in Boston for the Paul McCartney concert. Got a really amazing deal on Travelocity -- $118 per night -- which was so cheap it was an offer we couldn't refuse. The Charlesmark did not disappoint. Rooms, although small, are clean and well-designed and the location is fantastic. Staff is helpful, and the bar is a great place to have a drink at the end of your night. Speaking of the bar, if you are someone who likes to go to bed before 2 a.m. on a weekend, *do not* let them put you in one of the two rooms on the first floor (106 and 107). I read someone else's TA review that the noise wasn't a problem. Well, we were in 107 and it was fine on Thursday night, but on Friday night the noise was outrageous. The hotel was good about moving us the next day to a quieter room. (Really, they should just charge less for these rooms and let folks know the bargain they're striking!) Other than that, absolutely no complaints. A great deal.
reviews.title: Unbeatable value - in the right rooms!

reviews.text: P.S. Go to JP Licks on Newbury Street for the best ice cream you've ever had.
reviews.title: Best...Service...Ever...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a solo traveler with limited mobility due to multiple sclerosis, I am always concerned about accessibility issues. Because the Charlesmark is a small boutique hotel, they lack some amenities, and the property has some disability limitations, but this was more than made up for by the tremendous helpfulness of the staff. Practically every request was honored, up to and including staffers physically carrying my walker up stairs and hand-delivering ice and food to my room, always with a smile and a gracious attitude. And not one staffer would accept a tip for doing it. I was genuinely touched by the kindness and attentiveness of everyone from Mark the owner down to the housekeeping crew. Many thanks to Mark, Curt, Kelly, Katelyn and everyone for really making my trip! Best service I've ever had at a hotel, in Boston or elsewhere.
reviews.title: Using Tripadvisor paid off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I planned our 3 night trip to Boston many months in advance (September 08), looking at different hotels and taking particular note of prices and then looking on Tripadvisor for the experience of other people. Consequently we quickly eliminated one cheap hotel. We found most hotels were very expensive. However, one that was within our means was the Charlesmark. Having read the reviews we decided on a Queen size room, rather than standard. Booking the hotel was no problem - we exchanged emails and everything went smoothly - the hotel staff were very helpful. No charges were made until after we arrived.
reviews.title: Good location but small rooms

reviews.text: By UK standards, the room was a good size. We flew into Boston airport and easily took the metro all the way from the airport to Copley station, which was only a few steps from the hotel. We are both in our 50s but had no problems coping with a suitcase each and a flight bag. Well recommended as the metro cost only $2 each.
reviews.title: Great Value in Boston's Back bay

reviews.text: I've just got back from staying for 5 nights at the Charlesmark. The two best points about the hotel are the location and the fact that it's very clean. The staff are very laid back and friendly; the facilities are good; the breakfast is fine (well it is free); the bed was very comfortable; they have free video loan for guests. I stayed on the third floor in a corner room at the back. I did get a lot of noise during the first night (garbage trucks and deliveries), but otherwise it was fine. Stay here for good value, convenience (4 'T'stops to the Museum of Fine Arts and 4 to Government Centre and the change to the blue line to the Airport), and a friendly welcome. There's a good Thai restaurant next door ('Bangkok Blue'), plus you are just around the block from Newbury Street. Also just opposite is Boston Public Library (try the fab lunch buffet at their restaurant). The only minus point is that to heat the room it appears you have to put the air-con on, which is fairly noisy.
reviews.title: Good location and good value
Excellent staff and service
reviews.text: This is an ideally located hotel in Boston. The decor, breakfast, and amenities were outstanding. Most of all, I loved the helpful staff, especially Calvin. He helped get me a cab to the airport at 4 in the morning.
We have just returned to England after spending 5 days at the Charlesmark. The only thing I can find to complain about is that the new swanky cocktail bar was opening the day after we left.
reviews.title: Charlesmark is great
Nice touch
reviews.text: The rooms were super ,sound system great and the showers fabulous. we were on the 3rd floor and experienced very little street noise.
The staff were all friendly and helpful, plenty of on tap coffee. Bagels fruit and muffins at breakfast plus all the papers.
reviews.title: Ideally situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When they say the room is small and views will be of the brick building next door, they aren't joking. But the room was clean and nice, the staff really helpful, and the location great. Read the websites FAQ so you know what you are getting, we skipped the tiny breakfast and went down the street instead. Would stay here again if we come back without the family.
reviews.title: Small but great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was great. It is a smaller remodeled hotel and the rooms are small. But the remodel is very classy, the location is amazing, the price is great for the heart of Boston, and the rooms are created in a way that the feel bigger than they are. I was indecisive between giving this hotel a 4 and a 5. It is by no means a 5 star hotel but the service and overall value was awesome. I have literally no complaints and even at my favorite hotel ever I have a complaint so I gave this a 5.
reviews.title: Great deal. Honest about the size. Did its job well for the money

reviews.text: Super location as well as nice room - close to everything. Minutes from Fenway Park, shopping and walking distance from Boston Common and harbor. Hotel staff very helpful, nice breakfast. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: What a great place to stay! After dropping the rental car just up the street (it is easy walking distance), we arrived at the Charlemark around 10am - way to early to check in. It was no problem at all for the friendly and helpful guy at reception. We were soon seated in the coffee/bar area in the lobby having some coffee and doughnuts with a glass of ice water (it was extremely hot) and our luggage safely stowed in the reception area. We then headed out to explore Boston before returning later to check in.
reviews.title: This is how to do boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room on the 6th floor (601) overlooked Boylston Street and the public library. It was 'small but perfectly formed'. It is true as some reviewers have said that the bed is on the small side and the space to hang clothes is negligible. It may be tough to spend a week if you had to unpack a lot of stuff. For one or two nights though it is perfect. We experienced no issues at all with noise and did not ever see the bar over crowded. I certainly slept well.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: I went to grad school in Boston, so I knew I wanted a hotel near a T stop so I could easily get to and from the airport. This hotel in a traditional/old building with contemporary design is just a few steps from the Copley T stop and right across the street from the Boston Public Library. You can walk to the Public Gardens, shopping, and much more. Staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean, and they had jazz playing on the audio/video system when I walked into the room. (How did they know?)
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I reserved the cheapest/smallest room for the last night of a business trip but got a slight upgrade when I arrived. Rooms are compact but perfectly adequate unless the visitors only are comfortable in Midwest Best Westerns. There's a small desk and chair, but it's probably not the most comfortable if you're trying to work all day from your hotel room--but then, why would you? Take your computer to the library, a bar, the park, anywhere.
reviews.title: Curtains please!

reviews.text: While I agree with other reviewers that the convenient location of this hotel and the friendly helpful staff are notable qualities of the Charlesmark, my experience trying to sleep in a room facing Boylston Street was less than restful. The room I occupied was designed with a contemporary visual appeal, however the choice of a black venetian blind for window-covering was inadequate to block out the glare of the streetlights. The addition of black-out curtains to the decor would have bumped my rating of my stay at this hotel from the "average" to the "very good" category.
reviews.title: The Charming Charlesmark

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Charlesmark for three nights for business. I was a bit nervous because of the room size (which was clearly stated on their website) but I was absolutely BLOWN AWAY! This hotel is simply amazing. The location is wonderful, wonderful, wonderful. Literally right on the finish line of the Boston Marathon, amid shops, restaurants, bars and steps away from Newbury Street. The staff of this hotel was wonderful! When my husband (who only stayed one night with me) and I arrived early (well before check-in), we were greeted warmly and told they were happy to store our luggage for us. We were then given a map and asked if we needed any recommendations. Very helpful and friendly. The room, while small, was very comfortable and clean. The space was utilized well and the bed was incredibly comfortable. And the shower was wonderful--strong, clean and hot.
reviews.title: stay like family with luxurious accommodations (and a smile)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would absolutely recommend this hotel to everyone who is traveling alone or with just one other person. I don't think the rooms could comfortable accommodate more than two people...maybe the suites but they looked a bit tight as well. But should my husband and/or I ever end up in Boston again, we will certainly be staying at the Charlesmark!
reviews.title: Boutique hotel at reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say...staying at the Charlesmark Hotel was a pleasant surprise!! Located on Boylston Street, it was convenient to the Mass Pike, easy to find and had a parking garage nearby.
reviews.title: Wowed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were very helpful and welcoming. The room also was nice,,,on the 6th floor facing the road, but wasn't overly noisy. The Copley square station is nearby to get on T, and cabs going to the seaport are pretty easy to hail. The Prudential Tower is nearby..check out the 52nd floor at night!!!! Take the subway to Little Italy for a fantastice meal at the one of 100 restaurants...Do take the Duck tour and see the city from your amphibious vehicle that goes from street to the Charles River. The hotel was just great and the location perfect!!
reviews.title: The best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After checking in and being given a room downstairs with NO outside windows I asked about the room I was expecting which had windows albeit small. We were moved to the end of the hall downstairs ( room 101 I think) and had a room with windows to the alley. I didn't mind at all as long as I could see the day light. Room was very quiet (except for bathroom fan which seemed to run alot). Breakfast is pastry, bagels, cream cheese, jam, oatmeal packets, coffee, juice and fruit. I love hotels where breakfast of some sort is included as I hate forking over a fortune first thing in the AM. Location is awesome for shopping and very close to trains.
reviews.title: Great location but not so great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super location at reasonable price in Back Bay. Very friendly and helpful staff. The room (on 2 nd floor facing Boylston Street) was a disappointment. Bathroom was updated but the room looked tired. Lack of a desk-chair was a glaring omission and the black Venetian blind in lieu of a decent window treatment looked cheesy and was ineffective. Air conditioning was very noisy and was binary (full blast and freezing or off). The "free breakfast" was not worth it (bagels but no toaster, limited fruit and coffee).
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Spent a here night before flying home to the UK. The location of the hotel is great and the staff at the front desk were very helpful and accommodating. Were very pleased to be able to check in slightly early - we had been prepared to just leave bags and return later, also very pleased with the bag storage for our late check out on the next day. Compared to several hotels we have stayed in where the bags are out of sight in a cupboard to which everyone can get access we liked the locking together of the bags in a much more open area. The hotel was very open about the limited view from the lower rooms before we booked and we opted for a room facing the street. Not the quietest room that I have stayed in but you are in the middle of the city. Were slighltly worried about the size of the rooom before arriving but were pleasantly suprised - there was plenty of room for the two of us and there was a sofa as well (I think it would turn into a bed but we didn't need that), if you were staying longer the lack of hanging space for clothes may be an issue. My only reservation is about breakfast - not the quantity or quality (both were fine) but all was served on paper plates/bowls and in paper cups. Due to the position of the hotel maybe they would be better just not bothering with breakfast at all.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: I stayed at the Charlesmark while attending a conference at the nearby convention center. We arrived early Saturday morning, and our room was unfortunately not ready yet, but it was perfect time to take the time to go around. By the time we got back, our bags were in our room, and music greeted us as we entered the room (very nice!)
reviews.title: Felt like home..

reviews.text: If you're looking for a regular hotel room, this is NOT FOR YOU! I've only stayed in one boutique hotel (not by choice) in NYC, and this hotel room was so much better!
reviews.title: Half excellent / Half Poor = Average

reviews.text: Even though it's a boutique hotel, the room was pretty spacious. And the bathroom was really nice. Unfortunately, there aren't any closets so if you have to hang anything up, you have use the door knobs (bring hangers).
reviews.title: Great Property!

reviews.text: The room also had direct tv-so if you're looking to spend some time in your room, you'll definitely have something to keep you entertained.
reviews.title: Great location and excellent little find

reviews.text: I spent a little bit of time at the bar-which I thought was nice-nothing special. The hotel also had a small internet cafe with only two computers.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are modern, Stereos with surround sound speakers, DVD/CD Players and free movie library, free bottled water every day, free wireless internet , free breakfast. Such a deal!
reviews.title: Great Hotel , Stylish Hip Lounge , Outstanding Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beatifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The service provided by the staff was first class and genuine. The hotel has 40 rooms so the staff really get to know you.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: We went to the bar in the lounge every night and met some very cool people. It has a very hip vibe . Our bartender Jefferson was one of the most talented bartenders I have ever met. Smart, articulate and made great drinks.
reviews.title: center of the centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is the icing on the cake. Right in the middle of all the best retail shops and restauraunts.
reviews.title: Excellent time at the Charlesmark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend the Charlesmark.
reviews.title: Great location, but bring earplugs

reviews.text: Great location, excellent free wifi and 2 PCs in lobby, with free access to printers. (nice touch, much like Euro & Canadian hostels I've been to.
reviews.title: small but not quite boutique...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not a boutique hotel, so don't pay boutique prices (no more than $225/night, in my opinion)
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel - Just refuse to stay in Room 205 !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms are ok but small-ish.
reviews.title: Deserves its good ratings!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reserved through Booking.com. We were allocated room 205 whch has 2 generators directly outside the window and the noise is intolerable.Staff who were extremely helpful could not give us another room until the next day. This new room was on the 6th floor and made this hotel 'perfect'. Location is excellent and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Just ensure you do not get room 205 though !
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: Was lucky to get rooms when I called. More so cause I had booked for 3 nights but wanted to extend my stay for another 3 nights but couldnt because they were booked. Location is great. Right next to the "Subway". Its also walking distance from most of what you would need to see or do. Hotel is absolutely fantastic with the rooms and lobby done tastefully. Rooms and bathroom real small though its not really a problem. Fridge in the room along with the free internet, basic breakfast and free printing service. Hotel staff were a real plus as well especially a certain receptionist. She was a real delight. The bar at the lobby and the Thai joint right next door sum the place up.
reviews.title: Great location + price

reviews.text: There are many fabulous things about this hotel, which I will lay out below. I enjoyed my first stay, a year ago, but my recent stay was sadly clouded by two extremely noisy and sleepless nights.
reviews.title: My second stay here was not as good as my first: noise was awful

likes.disliked: — The noise was awful at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was given a standard room at the back of the hotel. You might think that this would be a quiet option (i.e. away from the main, busy street) but it was a bit of a nightmare, for two reasons. First, there's a very noisy vent that blows loudly through the night. With ear plugs, one can just about handle this. But second, at 3.30am every night an extremely loud garbage truck comes by, very slowly, to pick up what sound like glass bottles from the bins behind the restaurants. Yikes. It was really painful being woken up both nights by this crazy, crashing noise (I was in town to give some lectures, and so having sleep interrupted was a real downer).
reviews.title: Great Choice

likes.liked: — Quiet, comfortable room and friendly bar staff.
likes.disliked: — Front desk staff weren't too friendly

reviews.text: So you should be aware of this problem. If you are a very heavy sleeper, maybe you'll be fine.
reviews.title: Charlesmark marginal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the great things, there are many:
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: *Terrific location
reviews.title: Great hotel in a lively part of the city
Outstanding
reviews.text: Wow! I'm so glad I listened to all the posative reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. Beautiful clean comfortable rooms, awesome location and extremely helpful and friendly staff. We dropped by to see the hotel a few days before we were to stay there and they treated us like we were already guests - helping us with maps and area tips. The room we stayed in was small, but I don't mind that and very quiet. I felt it was well worth the price, which actually seemed really reasonable for all that you get. When we walked in to the room really nice soft music was playing in the speakers located around the room, cable music. They offer a video library. I had originally wanted a more rustic B&B style setting, but when I saw the room none of that mattered. Well executed modern theme. Breakfast is in their swanky lobby area with 2 computers with complimentary internet. We loved it.

My husband and I have just returned from visiting our daughter at college in Boston for parents weekend. Many of the hotels in the areas surrounding the colleges and universities tend to hike their prices up a bit and many of the 'affordable' hotels are often booked early. In the past we have stayed at the Fairmont Copley, the Hyatt in Cambridge, Marriott and others. The price of the Charlesmark was about $100 less than any of those for this same weekend so we decided to give it a try. So here is my review - the good and the not so good.
reviews.title: Parents Weekend
Great location and shower!
reviews.text: 1. Location is great. It was raining most of the weekend but it is only about 50 yards to the T stop. The hotel is also an easy walk to just about any type of store or restaurant you could need.

reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!
reviews.text: 2. Hotel Staff: We only met a couple members of the staff the entire time we were there and both were friendly.

reviews.title: Gourmet Service on a TV Dinner Budget
reviews.text: 3. Our room: Here is where the hotel looses points. From what I've gathered after re-reading all of the prior reviews, we were probably in one of the least desirable rooms of the hotel. Even though we payed extra ($249/ night before taxes) for a 'premium' room, our room was a dark, musty smelling room in the basement with no windows to the outside. The windows that were in the room looked out onto a hallway and have bars on them. Not only does this seem like a fire hazard to me (I asked and this would be a violation in Virginia) but the light from the hallway seeped in thru the shades and made for a miserable nights sleep. On the plus side, the room was very clean.

Friend suggested this hotel. Proved to be a great travel experience. Smack dab in Copley Square we walked to the upscale cafes on Newbury St. and hit all the best designer stores just across Boylston St. at Prudential Mall and Copley Place. Hotel is boutique style, small enough to be treated as family - - very friendly staff is all local and knows all there is to know about Boston. Hotel's lounge buzzes with good cheer and perfectly made cocktails. People are chatty and everybody feels at home. My window view looked out at the stately Boston Public Library. Not to be missed are tours of the art and sculpture inside the library and its two restaurants...one informal and the other, Sebastian's is very elegant. Formal high tea is served at 4 p.m. at Sebastian's which looks out into the library's outdoor enclosed courtyard with fountains and sculpture. Very posh! Hotel rooms are quiet, immaculate and comfortable. First floor lounge extends into large livingroom for socializing in fancy atmosphere of white leather couches and modern decor. Perfect for carrying on a conversation as low level music plays above. Great place to relax after work and sightseeing. We had a wonderful visit.
reviews.title: Absolutely Best Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our first ever trip to the USA. we had a three week itinerary part of which included two night stopoever in Boston. After reading reviews, we choose the Charlesmark. The hotel is well located and its an easy walk to all those places you want to see. We had travelled by train from NYC and the hotel is only a short walk from the Amtrak station.
reviews.title: Great location, good value...

reviews.text: The hotel is of the informal "boutique" variety and also has a public ground floor bar area. Reception was friendly and welcoming and we were assigned our standard room which was on a rear corner of the building on the fourth floor. Being on the corner meant we had two windows which gave a feeling of extra space to the rather small room size which others have commented on but is perhaps what is to be expected in a busy City. Having said that, they have made the best use of the space and the room and bathroom are clean, comfortable and well equipped and should suit most people for a stay of upto two or three nights.
reviews.title: Mind the Cockroach!
Loved it - Will return without doubt
reviews.text: A continental breakfast is provided but some may decide that it isnt worth bothering with. Cooked breakfast can be had at keen prices at local eateries and the hotel recognises this in its room literature. The lounge area has two internet terminals for those essential emails home to friends and family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a good value comfortable hotel in a great ,convenient location.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Myself and my wife stayed in the Charlesmark for three days in February. Put simply - it has to be the best hotel experience we have ever had. The location is superb as are the rooms (compact, comfortable and cosy). The hotel is very clean and the staff are helpful and friendly - nothing was too much bother.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Yet.
Loved it!!
reviews.text: I would have no hesitation in reccommending this fantastic value for money hotel to anyone.

The charlesmark hotel was a very awesome choice!! we had six girls for a bachelorette party -- so we were pretty loud and crazy!! our rooms were secluded from the rest of the hotel (so we didn't bother anyone) and the best part was the service. Everyone that works there was soooo nice and helpful and very funny!! We all agreed that the style of the hotel was very beautiful and modern. I would definetly stay there again and again!!
reviews.title: Excellent Everything

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I recently had the pleasure of visiting Boston and staying at the Charlesmark. The hotel is absolutely wonderful (and so fairly priced too)! Our room was very nicely furnished and very modern and the bathroom was very clean with a nice healthy supply of white fluffy towels. The satellite TV was an added bonus.
reviews.title: The place to stay.............
Great rates, great service, great bar
reviews.text: The location is great - very close to the subway station (which can take you practically anywhere in the city and beyond); walking distance to the coolest shops and restaurants and other places like the pharmacy and if need be, the grocery store. My boyfriend and I love to walk so we found it quite convenient to be able to shop downtown and then walk back to the hotel (mind you, it's a bit of a walk but nothing too damaging).
The first time that I disagree with the reviews.
reviews.title: All show and little substance

reviews.text: The hotel is expensive for the cost that I´ve paid.
reviews.title: Loved Charlesmark!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was ugly when I arrived for the check in
reviews.title: Good value!

reviews.text: The Charlesmark is a charm of a hotel..with only 40 or so rooms you really feel like its home away from home.Went with my teenage daughter for two nights and it was the perfect location.
reviews.title: it was impossible to have information and to reserve!!!

reviews.text: All the staff was extremely pleasant..especially Kyle, the hotel Manager..he always greeted us with a smile and hello upon entering and exiting the hotel. The bar area was great! Everyone is so friendly and the martinis were terrific. The Thai food which we enjoyed on the outside patio was incredible.
reviews.title: Local, More Interesting Hotel than rest of area

reviews.text: This hotel absolutely met my expectations during my trip to Boston. The staff members were friendly and helpful, the room clean, and the location extremely convenient. I appreciated large windows in my room, as well as the modern decor. This is not a luxury experience, but was more than adequate in terms of comfort and amenities. The towels actually smelled as fresh as if I had washed them at home, and the shower was quite nice. I was a little surprised that there was no bathtub in the bathroom, but really I shouldn't have expected it given the "boutique" nature of the room. The best perks were free wireless internet, affordability and location.
reviews.title: Nicely decorated, convenient and affordable.

reviews.text: Small boutique hotel offers excellent value in a high priced neighborhood. Rooms are reasonably sized, with premium sound systems. Continental breakfast is included. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but there is a decent, inexpensive Thai place next door, and for a splurge, Morton's steakhouse is a few steps away.
reviews.title: Good Value inb Boston

reviews.text: What staff lacks in polish, they may up for in friendliness.
reviews.title: Loved my stay....

likes.disliked: — Nothing - Not A Picky Person, However I Do Like Nice Things

reviews.text: Overall, a very satisfying experience.
reviews.title: Charlesmark is a great boutique hotel

likes.disliked: — Request the size bed you would like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay at the Charlesmarks hotel. The price was reasonable and I was close to where I had to go.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem!

reviews.text: I was greeted warmly by the Hotel Owner and Staff. Inside the room, they have an excellent stereo system and DVDs to choose from. The room was small, but very hip with a great view of the city. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Superb Service
Wonderful place to stay!
reviews.text: I just spent four nights at the Charlesmark Hotel and could not have been happier with our stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very stylish. My wife and I were very pleased with the entertainment system and the wonderful classical music that was playing when we entered our room. The bar/lounge that has recently opened has an relaxed and comfortable atmosphere and a great martini menu. We are planning on coming back to Boston next year and will definately be staying at the Charlesmark.

Stayed for two days with my husband and 9 year old daughter. I came to this hotel because of all the great reviews I read on this website and I was not disappointed. I did have a room in the basement but the noise was minimal and other than that the room was very nice and clean. The best thing I can say about this hotel is the staff were great. We had never been to Boston before and they were a great help getting us to where we wanted to go and offering recommendations. I don't think the larger hotels in the area could offer this kind of attention to their guests needs. I did a lot of research before choosing this hotel and I am glad I did--the other hotels in the area were way too expensive. I would definitely go back. Thanks for a great stay!
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Pricey Boston

reviews.text: I just returned home from three nights spent at the Charlesmark with my sister and mother. I chose this hotel because of its location, its rates, and the recommendations on this and other Web sites. I was NOT disappointed. We found the staff exceptionally helpful, the rooms very well appointed, and the location highly desirable. If I could improve on anything, it would be the size of our room. (The three of us stayed in a room with one queen bed and a small couch that converted into a bed.)
reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: Calvin, Kyle, and Dolores -- the staff members on hand during our stay -- spared nothing to satisfy us. They were friendly, helpful, kind, and accommodating.
reviews.title: Great hotel...with just a few quirks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - AAA1!!!!
reviews.title: Great Spot!!

likes.disliked: — Price a little high - but seems to be OK (or better than OK) for Boston.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted very nicely, with some advice as to how to get started in the city. Our bags were looked after, even though we checked in early, & were found in our room, after an initial lunch & neighbourhood tour.
reviews.title: Conveinient Boston Boutique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being a walking city, we took advantage & strolled from here to most points of interest in the city - Heritage Trail, Italian District, Financial District, China Town, Harbourfront walk, etc. - & to the west, Fenway Park. Then, of course, the incredible Duck Tour (ha, ha) was just around the corner.
reviews.title: what a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic, fantastic city!!!
reviews.title: Incredible Value and Great Hotel
The only place to stay
reviews.text: What little time was spent in the room was great - very comfortable bed, which was so welcome after the miles put on the feet - TV & sound system very good, but really just used for news/weather updates (Goodness, was it hot). Good continental breakfast, & access to internet/email appreciated, as it allowed us to stay in touch.
The hotel : small boutique hotel, modern & tasteful decor through out the hotel.
reviews.title: great base to explore Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location : near Copley sq., Newbury st. & Prudential mall, pretty of shops & restaurants, near subway, the ride to-from the airport is around $30.
reviews.title: Awesome location, small but cozy

reviews.text: The check-in & check-out : fast, accurate.
reviews.title: Good Manhattans, Great Service!

reviews.text: The breakfast : free bagel & hot drinks.
reviews.title: Boston "Pensione"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room : very small, very clean, the bed is incredibly great, the decor is modern with very clever use of materials, the air con works very well, no nice view, mine is facing the service alley with disturbing noise in the early morning.
reviews.title: Great Overnight Stay
Great value - great location
reviews.text: This hotel is all about cost and location. Compared to most hotels in Boston with such a good location, this is great value for money. Yes, the standard rooms are small but more of a problem was the small bed. However the rooms are very clean and well equipped. Great shower, good bedding and towels and the room cleaned and re-equipped each day. Above all else this hotel is in a great location. You can literally walk anywhere and the subway, which is safe and efficient if a little shabby, is right across the road. Overall, excellent value for money for Boston.
Here's the good:
reviews.title: Mostly good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Very convenient location close to the T
reviews.title: fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Nicely furnished room and nice decor throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Beware of small rooms, but great location

reviews.text: -Even though the hotel doesn't offer any official laundry service, the front desk staff accommodated our laundry needs by getting housekeeping to put a load on for us while we were out touring the city (for a $10 fee).
reviews.title: Needs a little freshening up

description: European styled boutique Hotel set in former private residence dating from 1892; situated in the Back Bay neighborhood.
